meanings.sent1: She reinstalls the software on her computer after it crashes.
meanings.sent2: He reinstalls the curtains in the living room after washing them.
meanings.sent3: The chef reinstalls the ingredients in the fridge after the power outage.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic reinstalls the engine, making the car run smoothly again.
meanings.sent5: The gardener reinstalls the plants in the garden, creating a fresh look.

meanings.definition: To put back in place or restore to a previous position or condition.
meanings.sent1: After the storm, they reinstalls the fallen fence in the backyard.
meanings.sent2: The librarian reinstalls the books on the shelves after the library renovation.
meanings.sent3: The kids playfully reinstalls the toys in their room after cleaning up.
meanings.sent4: The artist reinstalls the painting on the wall, completing the exhibition.
meanings.sent5: The janitor reinstalls the broken sign outside, making it look brand new.
